alternative_parents.description: Glycoside in which a sugar group is bonded through one carbon to another group via a O-glycosidic bond.
alternative_parents.name: O-glycosyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing two carbohydrate moieties linked to each to each other through a glycosidic bond, no set of three or more glycosidically linked carbohydrate units.
alternative_parents.name: Disaccharides

alternative_parents.description: Cyclitols, or derivatives thereof with at least one hydroxyl group replace by an amino group. These of also include derivatives where the hydrogen atom of one or more of the hydroxyl groups is replaced with another atom.
alternative_parents.name: Aminocyclitols and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a cyclohexylamine moiety, which consist of a cyclohexane ring attached to an amine group.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclohexylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an alcohol group attached to a cyclohexane ring.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclohexanols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an oxane (tetrahydropyran) ring, which is a six-member saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one oxygen atom and five carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Oxanes

alternative_parents.description: Heterocyclic compounds containing a saturated, aliphatic, five-membered ring where a carbon is replaced by an oxygen.
alternative_parents.name: Tetrahydrofurans

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.
alternative_parents.name: 1,2-aminoalcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds having the structure R2C(OR')2 ( R' not Hydrogen) and thus diethers of geminal diols. Originally, the term was confined to derivatives of aldehydes (one R = H), but it now applies equally to derivatives of ketones (neither R = H ). Mixed acetals have different R' groups.
alternative_parents.name: Acetals

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an primary aliphatic amine group.
alternative_parents.name: Monoalkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
class.name: Organooxygen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 4,5-disubstituted 2-deoxystreptamines. These are 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides that a glycosidically linked to a pyranose of furanose unit at the C4- and C5-positions.

direct_parent.description: 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides that a glycosidically linked to a pyranose of furanose unit at the C4- and C5-positions.
direct_parent.name: 4,5-disubstituted 2-deoxystreptamines

intermediate_nodes.description: Saccharides containing a sugar unit that bears an amino group.
intermediate_nodes.name: Aminosaccharides

intermediate_nodes.description: Molecules or a portion of a molecule composed of amino-modified sugars.
intermediate_nodes.name: Aminoglycosides

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds containing an amicocyclitol moiety glycosidically linked to a carbohydrate moiety. There are two major classes of aminoglycosides containing a 2-streptamine core. They are called 4,5- and 4,6-disubstituted 2-deoxystreptamines.
intermediate_nodes.name: Aminocyclitol glycosides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Monosaccharides, disaccharides, oligosaccharides, polysaccharides, and their derivatives.
subclass.name: Carbohydrates and carbohydrate conjugates

superclass.description: Organic compounds that contain one or more oxygen atoms.
superclass.name: Organic oxygen compounds
